docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide will walk you through installing EO-Toolkit on a Ubuntu server system.

docs.title: Operating System
docs.text: • Ubuntu Server (18.04 or later recommended)

docs.title: Required Software
docs.text:
Before installing EO-Toolkit, ensure your system has the following software installed:

  • PostgreSQL and its developer packages
  • PostGIS (spatial database extension)
  • Redis (for Celery task queue)
  • Git
  • GDAL (Geospatial Data Abstraction Library)
  • Apache web server
  • Build-essential (compilers)
  • Python 3 development packages

docs.title: Step 1: Install System Dependencies
docs.text:
Open a terminal and run the following commands:

# Update package list
sudo apt-get update

# Install required libraries
sudo apt-get install -y gdal-bin apache2 postgis redis-server \
    build-essential python3-dev libpq-dev pango1.0-tools

# Install PostgreSQL with PostGIS
sudo apt-get install -y postgresql postgresql-postgis

# Install uWSGI module for Apache
sudo apt install -y libapache2-mod-uwsgi

docs.title: Create PostgreSQL User and Database
docs.text:
# Create a PostgreSQL user
sudo -u postgres createuser etoolkit

# Open PostgreSQL command line
sudo -u postgres psql

In the PostgreSQL command line (psql), execute:

-- Change password of postgres user
ALTER USER postgres PASSWORD 'etoolkit';

-- Set password for etoolkit user
ALTER USER etoolkit PASSWORD 'etoolkit123';

-- Grant superuser privileges (for development)
ALTER USER etoolkit WITH SUPERUSER;

-- Exit psql
\q

docs.title: Create Database with PostGIS Extension
docs.text:
# Create the database
createdb -U etoolkit -h localhost etoolkit

# Enable PostGIS extension
psql -U etoolkit -h localhost etoolkit -c "CREATE EXTENSION postgis"

Database Credentials

Remember to change the default passwords in production environments!

docs.title: Step 3: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
# Navigate to your desired installation directory
cd /home/yourusername/

# Clone the repository
git clone <repository-url> etoolkit
cd etoolkit

docs.title: Step 4: Python Virtual Environment Setup
docs.text:
# Navigate to the webapp directory
cd etoolkit/webapp

# Create a Python 3 virtual environment
python3 -m venv venv

# Activate the virtual environment
source venv/bin/activate

docs.title: Step 5: Install Python Dependencies
docs.text:
# Upgrade pip
pip install --upgrade pip

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Step 6: Configure Django Settings
docs.text:
Edit the Django settings file to configure database connection and other settings:

# Edit settings.py
nano etoolkit/settings.py

Update the following settings:

DATABASES = {
    'default': {
        'ENGINE': 'django.contrib.gis.db.backends.postgis',
        'NAME': 'etoolkit',
        'USER': 'etoolkit',
        'PASSWORD': 'etoolkit123',
        'HOST': 'localhost',
        'PORT': '5432',
    }
}

Also configure: - GEOSERVER_URL - GEOSERVER_WMS_URL - GEOSERVER_USER - GEOSERVER_PASSWORD - GEOSERVER_WORKSPACE - SECRET_KEY (generate a new one for production)

docs.title: Step 7: Initialize Database
docs.text:
# Create database migrations
python manage.py makemigrations webapp

# Apply migrations
python manage.py migrate

# Collect static files
python manage.py collectstatic

docs.title: Step 8: Create Superuser
docs.text:
Create an admin user to access the Django admin panel:

python manage.py createsuperuser --username admin

Follow the prompts to set email and password.

docs.title: Development Mode Testing
docs.text:
# Start Celery worker (in a separate terminal)
celery -A etoolkit worker -l INFO

# Start Django development server
python manage.py runserver

# Or run on a specific port
python manage.py runserver 127.0.0.1:8002

Open your web browser and navigate to: - http://127.0.0.1:8000/ (or your configured port) - http://server_ip:8002/ (for access from other devices on the network)

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Configure your environment
  • Set up for production deployment
  • Learn the basics

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
If you encounter issues during installation:

  1. Permission Errors: Ensure your user has proper permissions for the project directory
  2. Database Connection: Verify PostgreSQL is running: sudo systemctl status postgresql
  3. GDAL Issues: Check GDAL installation: gdalinfo --version
  4. Python Packages: Ensure virtual environment is activated before installing packages

For more help, see the Troubleshooting section.

docs.title: Common Issues and Solutions
docs.text: This guide covers common issues encountered when using EO-Toolkit and their solutions.

docs.title: Database Connection Failed
docs.text:
Problem: Cannot connect to PostgreSQL database

Solutions: - Verify PostgreSQL is running: sudo systemctl status postgresql - Check database credentials in settings - Verify database exists: psql -U etoolkit -l - Check PostgreSQL is listening: sudo netstat -tlnp | grep 5432

docs.title: GDAL Installation Issues
docs.text:
Problem: GDAL-related errors

Solutions: - Verify GDAL installed: gdalinfo --version - Install GDAL development packages: sudo apt-get install gdal-bin libgdal-dev - Rebuild Python GDAL bindings if needed

docs.title: Permission Errors
docs.text:
Problem: Permission denied errors

Solutions: 

# Fix ownership
sudo chown -R user:user /path/to/etoolkit

# Fix permissions
sudo chmod -R 755 /path/to/etoolkit

# For media directory
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /path/to/etoolkit/media

docs.title: Static Files Not Loading
docs.text:
Problem: CSS/JS files not loading

Solutions: - Collect static files: python manage.py collectstatic - Check STATIC_ROOT and STATIC_URL settings - Verify Apache/Apache configuration - Check file permissions

docs.title: Media Files Not Accessible
docs.text:
Problem: Uploaded files not accessible

Solutions: - Check MEDIA_ROOT and MEDIA_URL settings - Verify media directory exists and has permissions - Check Apache configuration for media alias - Verify file permissions

docs.title: GeoServer Connection Failed
docs.text:
Problem: Cannot connect to GeoServer

Solutions: - Verify GeoServer is running - Check GeoServer URL in settings - Verify credentials - Test connection: curl -u user:pass http://geoserver:8080/geoserver/rest/workspaces.json

docs.title: Celery Tasks Not Processing
docs.text:
Problem: Tasks queued but not executing

Solutions: - Check Celery workers running: sudo systemctl status etoolkit_celery - Verify Redis connection: redis-cli ping - Check Celery logs: tail -f /path/to/log/celery/worker1.log - Restart Celery: sudo systemctl restart etoolkit_celery

docs.title: Cannot Log In
docs.text:
Problem: Login fails

Solutions: - Verify credentials - Check account is active - Verify email is verified - Check for account lockout - Clear browser cookies

docs.title: Email Verification Not Working
docs.text:
Problem: OTP email not received

Solutions: - Check spam folder - Verify email configuration - Check email server logs - Verify email address - Try resending OTP

docs.title: Area Upload Fails
docs.text:
Problem: GeoJSON upload fails

Solutions: - Verify file format (valid GeoJSON) - Check geometry type (Polygon/MultiPolygon) - Ensure EPSG:4326 coordinate system - Check file size limits - Verify file is not corrupted

docs.title: Slow Page Loads
docs.text:
Problem: Pages load slowly

Solutions: - Check server resources (CPU, memory) - Optimize database queries - Enable caching - Check network connectivity - Review Apache/uWSGI configuration

docs.title: Analysis Takes Too Long
docs.text:
Problem: Analyses run very slowly

Solutions: - Reduce area size - Limit temporal range - Check GEE quota limits - Verify server resources - Check for concurrent analyses

docs.title: High Memory Usage
docs.text:
Problem: Server running out of memory

Solutions: - Reduce uWSGI workers - Reduce Celery concurrency - Optimize GeoServer configuration - Add swap space - Consider server upgrade

docs.title: uWSGI Not Starting
docs.text:
Problem: uWSGI service fails to start

Solutions: - Check configuration file paths - Verify virtual environment path - Check log files for errors - Verify user permissions - Check socket file permissions

docs.title: Apache Configuration Errors
docs.text:
Problem: Apache won't start or serve site

Solutions: - Test configuration: sudo apachectl configtest - Check error logs: sudo tail -f /var/log/apache2/error.log - Verify modules enabled: sudo a2enmod uwsgi ssl - Check virtual host configuration

docs.title: SSL Certificate Issues
docs.text:
Problem: SSL certificate errors

Solutions: - Verify certificate paths - Check certificate validity - Renew expired certificates - Verify certificate chain - Check Apache SSL configuration

docs.title: Dataset Not Loading
docs.text:
Problem: Dataset fails to load on map

Solutions: - Verify dataset exists - Check GeoServer layer published - Test WMS URL directly - Verify area within data coverage - Check browser console for errors

docs.title: Analysis Returns No Data
docs.text:
Problem: Analysis completes but shows no data

Solutions: - Verify area within data coverage - Check date range validity - Ensure area geometry is valid - Try different area - Check data availability for region

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If issues persist:

  1. Check logs for detailed error messages
  2. Review relevant documentation sections
  3. Search for similar issues
  4. Contact support with:
  5. Error messages
  6. Steps to reproduce
  7. System information
  8. Relevant log excerpts

Next: Error Messages

docs.title: Error Messages Reference
docs.text: Common error messages in EO-Toolkit and their meanings.

docs.title: "Invalid username or password"
docs.text:
Cause: Incorrect credentials or account not verified

Solution: - Verify username and password - Check account is verified - Try password reset if needed

docs.title: "Account is inactive"
docs.text:
Cause: Email not verified

Solution: Complete email verification process

docs.title: "CSRF verification failed"
docs.text:
Cause: Missing or invalid CSRF token

Solution: - Refresh the page - Clear browser cookies - Ensure CSRF token included in requests

docs.title: "relation does not exist"
docs.text:
Cause: Database migrations not applied

Solution: 

python manage.py migrate

docs.title: "connection refused"
docs.text:
Cause: PostgreSQL not running or wrong connection details

Solution: - Check PostgreSQL status - Verify connection settings - Check firewall rules

docs.title: "Unsupported geometry types"
docs.text:
Cause: GeoJSON contains unsupported geometry

Solution: Use only Polygon or MultiPolygon geometries

docs.title: "File too large"
docs.text:
Cause: Upload exceeds size limit

Solution: Reduce file size or increase limit

docs.title: "Invalid GeoJSON"
docs.text:
Cause: Malformed GeoJSON file

Solution: Validate GeoJSON format before upload

docs.title: "Area outside data coverage"
docs.text:
Cause: Selected area not covered by dataset

Solution: Select area within dataset coverage

docs.title: "Analysis timeout"
docs.text:
Cause: Analysis taking too long

Solution: - Reduce area size - Limit temporal range - Try again later

docs.title: "GEE quota exceeded"
docs.text:
Cause: Google Earth Engine quota limit reached

Solution: - Wait for quota reset - Reduce request frequency - Contact support

docs.title: "Layer not found"
docs.text:
Cause: Layer not published in GeoServer

Solution: - Check layer exists - Verify layer is published - Check workspace name

docs.title: "WMS request failed"
docs.text:
Cause: GeoServer connection issue

Solution: - Verify GeoServer running - Check WMS service enabled - Test GeoServer connection

docs.title: "Task failed"
docs.text:
Cause: Error during task execution

Solution: - Check task logs - Review error details - Try again - Contact support if persistent

docs.title: "Task timeout"
docs.text:
Cause: Task exceeded time limit

Solution: - Task may be too complex - Check server resources - Contact support

docs.title: "400 Bad Request"
docs.text:
Cause: Invalid request parameters

Solution: - Verify required parameters - Check parameter formats - Review API documentation

docs.title: "401 Unauthorized"
docs.text:
Cause: Not authenticated

Solution: Log in and retry

docs.title: "404 Not Found"
docs.text:
Cause: Resource doesn't exist

Solution: Verify resource ID or URL

docs.title: "500 Internal Server Error"
docs.text:
Cause: Server error

Solution: - Check server logs - Contact support - Try again later

docs.title: "Permission denied"
docs.text:
Cause: Insufficient permissions

Solution: - Check file permissions - Verify user permissions - Contact administrator

docs.title: "Service unavailable"
docs.text:
Cause: Service not running

Solution: - Check service status - Restart service if needed - Contact administrator

Next: Performance Issues

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text: Guide for optimizing EO-Toolkit performance.

docs.title: CPU
docs.text:
• Monitor CPU usage
  • Scale workers based on CPU cores
  • Optimize heavy computations
  • Use async processing for long tasks

docs.title: Memory
docs.text:
• Monitor memory usage
  • Adjust worker counts
  • Optimize data processing
  • Add swap if needed

docs.title: Disk
docs.text:
• Monitor disk space
  • Clean old files regularly
  • Optimize database
  • Use separate disk for media if possible

docs.title: Indexes
docs.text: Ensure proper indexes on: - User foreign keys - Area lookups - Task queries - Frequently filtered fields

docs.title: Query Optimization
docs.text:
• Use select_related/prefetch_related
  • Avoid N+1 queries
  • Use database query analyzer
  • Cache frequent queries

docs.title: Connection Pooling
docs.text:
• Configure appropriate pool size
  • Monitor connection usage
  • Reuse connections

docs.title: Static Files
docs.text:
• Serve via CDN or separate server
  • Enable compression
  • Use browser caching
  • Minimize file sizes

docs.title: Caching
docs.text:
• Enable Django caching
  • Cache expensive computations
  • Use Redis for session storage
  • Cache API responses where appropriate

docs.title: Code Optimization
docs.text:
• Profile slow code paths
  • Optimize algorithms
  • Use async where beneficial
  • Minimize database queries

docs.title: Worker Configuration
docs.text:
# CPU-bound
processes = (2 * CPU cores) + 1
threads = 2

# I/O-bound
processes = CPU cores
threads = 4

docs.title: Memory Limits
docs.text:
limit-as = 512
reload-on-as = 400

docs.title: Timeouts
docs.text:
harakiri = 60
socket-timeout = 60

docs.title: Worker Configuration
docs.text:
• Adjust concurrency based on tasks
  • Use appropriate time limits
  • Monitor worker performance
  • Scale workers horizontally

docs.title: Task Optimization
docs.text:
• Break large tasks into smaller ones
  • Use appropriate task priorities
  • Implement task retries
  • Monitor task execution times

docs.title: Layer Optimization
docs.text:
• Use appropriate resolutions
  • Enable tiling for large datasets
  • Optimize raster files
  • Use appropriate projections

docs.title: Caching
docs.text:
• Enable GeoServer caching
  • Configure cache directories
  • Use tile caching
  • Monitor cache performance

docs.title: Metrics to Monitor
docs.text:
• Response times
  • Error rates
  • Resource usage
  • Task queue length
  • Database query times

docs.title: Tools
docs.text:
• Application performance monitoring
  • Server monitoring
  • Database monitoring
  • Log aggregation

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Regular Monitoring: Monitor performance regularly
  2. Baseline Metrics: Establish performance baselines
  3. Incremental Optimization: Optimize incrementally
  4. Load Testing: Test under load
  5. Documentation: Document optimizations
  6. Review: Regular performance reviews

Return to: Common Issues

docs.title: Analysis Tools Guide
docs.text: EO-Toolkit provides powerful analysis tools for Earth Observation data. This guide covers all available analysis types and how to use them.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Available analysis types:

  • LULC: Land Use Land Cover analysis
  • PCP: Precipitation analysis (CHIRPS)
  • ETa: Actual Evapotranspiration
  • Climate Change: SSP245 and SSP585 scenarios
  • GRACE: Water storage analysis

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before running analyses:

  1. Select an Area: Choose or create an area of interest
  2. Check Data Availability: Ensure data covers your area and time period
  3. Internet Connection: Required for Google Earth Engine analyses

docs.title: Basic Steps
docs.text:
1. Select Area: Choose your area of interest from the area selector
  2. Choose Analysis Type: Select from available analysis types
  3. Configure Parameters: Set any required parameters (dates, etc.)
  4. Run Analysis: Click the run button
  5. View Results: Results appear in charts and visualizations

docs.title: Analysis Interface
docs.text:
The analysis interface typically includes:

  • Area Selector: Choose your area
  • Analysis Type Selector: Select analysis type
  • Parameter Controls: Date ranges, options, etc.
  • Run Button: Execute the analysis
  • Results Panel: View charts and data

docs.title: Land Use Land Cover (LULC)
docs.text:
Purpose: Analyze land cover types and their distribution

Data Source: Google Earth Engine (ESA WorldCover or similar)

Output: - Pie chart showing land cover distribution - Area statistics (hectares) per land cover type - Percentage breakdown

Land Cover Classes (example): - Cropland - Grassland - Tree Cover - Shrubland - Built-up - Water Bodies - Bare/Sparse Vegetation - Wetlands

Usage: 1. Select your area 2. Choose "LULC" analysis type 3. Click "Run Analysis" 4. View pie chart and statistics

Use Cases: - Agricultural planning - Forest monitoring - Urban development - Environmental assessment

docs.title: Precipitation Analysis (PCP)
docs.text:
Purpose: Analyze precipitation patterns and trends

Data Source: CHIRPS (Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data)

Parameters: - Start Year: Beginning of analysis period - End Year: End of analysis period - Aggregation: Annual, Monthly, etc.

Output: - Time series chart of precipitation - Annual/seasonal statistics - Trend analysis

Usage: 1. Select your area 2. Choose "PCP" analysis type 3. Set date range (if applicable) 4. Click "Run Analysis" 5. View time series chart

Use Cases: - Drought monitoring - Water resource planning - Agricultural planning - Climate studies

docs.title: Actual Evapotranspiration (ETa)
docs.text:
Purpose: Analyze actual evapotranspiration rates

Data Source: WaPOR (Water Productivity Open-access Portal)

Parameters: - Start Year: Beginning of analysis period - End Year: End of analysis period - Aggregation: Annual, Monthly, etc.

Output: - Time series chart of ETa - Seasonal patterns - Trend analysis

Usage: 1. Select your area 2. Choose "ETa" analysis type 3. Set date range 4. Click "Run Analysis" 5. View time series chart

Use Cases: - Irrigation planning - Water management - Agricultural productivity - Drought assessment

docs.title: Climate Change Analysis
docs.text:
Purpose: Project future climate scenarios

Scenarios Available: - SSP245: Moderate emissions scenario - SSP585: High emissions scenario

Parameters: - Scenario: SSP245 or SSP585 - Projection period: Future years

Output: - Temperature projections - Precipitation projections - Trend analysis - Comparison charts

Usage: 1. Select your area 2. Choose "Climate Change" analysis 3. Select scenario (SSP245 or SSP585) 4. Click "Run Analysis" 5. View projection charts

Use Cases: - Climate adaptation planning - Risk assessment - Long-term planning - Policy development

docs.title: Water Storage Analysis (GRACE)
docs.text:
Purpose: Analyze terrestrial water storage changes

Data Source: GRACE (Gravity Recovery and Climate Experiment)

Output: - Time series of water storage - Trends and anomalies - Seasonal patterns

Usage: 1. Select your area 2. Choose "GRACE" analysis type 3. Click "Run Analysis" 4. View time series chart

Use Cases: - Groundwater monitoring - Water resource assessment - Drought analysis - Hydrological studies

docs.title: Charts and Visualizations
docs.text:
Results are displayed as:

  • Time Series Charts: Temporal trends over time
  • Pie Charts: Distribution of categories
  • Bar Charts: Comparison of values
  • Line Charts: Trends and patterns

docs.title: Interpreting Results
docs.text:
1. Check Time Period: Verify the analysis period
  2. Review Statistics: Check mean, min, max values
  3. Identify Trends: Look for increasing/decreasing patterns
  4. Compare Periods: Compare different time periods if available
  5. Consider Context: Factor in local conditions

docs.title: Exporting Results
docs.text:
• Screenshots: Capture charts for reports
  • Data Export: Download raw data (if available)
  • Report Generation: Include in comprehensive reports

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Start Simple: Begin with basic analyses
  2. Verify Area: Ensure area is correctly selected
  3. Check Coverage: Verify data availability for your area
  4. Review Results: Always review results for reasonableness
  5. Document: Note analysis parameters and dates
  6. Compare: Run multiple analyses for comprehensive insights

docs.title: Processing Time
docs.text:
• Small Areas: Usually quick (< 1 minute)
  • Medium Areas: May take 1-5 minutes
  • Large Areas: Can take 5-15+ minutes
  • Complex Analyses: May take longer

docs.title: Factors Affecting Speed
docs.text:
• Area size
  • Analysis complexity
  • Data availability
  • Server load
  • Internet connection

docs.title: Tips for Faster Processing
docs.text:
• Use smaller areas when possible
  • Avoid peak usage times
  • Check server status
  • Be patient for large/complex analyses

docs.title: Analysis Failed
docs.text:
Problem: Analysis returns an error

Solutions: - Verify area is selected - Check data availability for area/time - Try a smaller area - Check internet connection - Try again after a moment

docs.title: No Results
docs.text:
Problem: Analysis completes but shows no data

Solutions: - Verify area is within data coverage - Check date range is valid - Ensure area geometry is valid - Try a different area

docs.title: Slow Performance
docs.text:
Problem: Analysis takes very long

Solutions: - Reduce area size - Check server status - Try during off-peak hours - Contact support if persistent

docs.title: Incorrect Results
docs.text:
Problem: Results seem incorrect

Solutions: - Verify area selection - Check analysis parameters - Review data source documentation - Compare with known values - Contact support with details

docs.title: Combining Analyses
docs.text:
Run multiple analyses for comprehensive insights:

  1. Run LULC for land cover
  2. Run PCP for precipitation
  3. Run ETa for water use
  4. Compare results
  5. Generate combined report

docs.title: Time Series Analysis
docs.text:
• Compare different time periods
  • Identify seasonal patterns
  • Detect trends and anomalies
  • Project future scenarios

Next: Reports Guide

docs.title: Area Management Guide
docs.text: Areas of Interest (AOIs) are fundamental to running analyses in EO-Toolkit. This guide covers creating, managing, and using areas.

docs.title: What are Areas?
docs.text:
Areas define the geographic boundaries for your analyses. They can be:

  • Drawn directly on the map
  • Uploaded as GeoJSON files
  • Saved for reuse across multiple analyses
  • Organized by country

docs.title: Method 1: Drawing on Map
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the map interface (Data Map or Search page)
  2. Click the Draw Polygon tool
  3. Click on the map to create vertices:
  4. Each click adds a vertex
  5. Double-click to finish the polygon
  6. Right-click to cancel
  7. A form will appear:
  8. Area Name: Enter a descriptive name
  9. Country: Select the country
  10. Click Save Area

Drawing Tips

  • Start with a small area for testing
  • Use zoom to draw precisely
  • You can edit vertices before saving
  • Polygons must be closed shapes

docs.title: Method 2: Uploading GeoJSON
docs.text:
1. Prepare your GeoJSON file:
  2. Must contain Polygon or MultiPolygon geometries
  3. Should be in EPSG:4326 (WGS84) coordinate system

  4. Can contain multiple features (will be merged)

  5. Navigate to the map interface

  6. Click Upload Area or Import GeoJSON
  7. Select your GeoJSON file
  8. Fill in the form:
  9. Area Name: Descriptive name
  10. Country: Select country
  11. Click Upload

File Requirements

  • Supported formats: GeoJSON (.geojson, .json)
  • Geometry types: Polygon or MultiPolygon only
  • Coordinate system: EPSG:4326 (will be converted if needed)
  • Maximum file size: Check system limits

docs.title: Area Validation
docs.text:
The system validates uploaded areas:

  • Geometry Type: Only Polygon/MultiPolygon accepted
  • Coordinate System: Converts to EPSG:4326 if needed
  • Z-coordinates: Automatically removed if present
  • Duplicate Names: Prevents duplicate names per country

docs.title: Viewing Your Areas
docs.text:
1. Access the area selector (usually in map interface)
  2. Select a country from the dropdown
  3. View list of your saved areas for that country
  4. Click an area to load it on the map

docs.title: Area List Features
docs.text:
• Name: Area identifier
  • Country: Associated country
  • Actions: View, Edit, Delete options

docs.title: Editing Areas
docs.text:
Currently, areas cannot be edited directly. To modify:

  1. Delete the existing area
  2. Create a new area with updated geometry
  3. Or contact support for assistance

docs.title: Deleting Areas
docs.text:
1. Select the area from the list
  2. Click Delete or trash icon
  3. Confirm deletion
  4. Area and associated data are removed

Deletion Warning

Deleting an area will also delete: - Associated analysis results - Generated reports - Task history

Consider exporting important data before deletion.

docs.title: Selecting an Area for Analysis
docs.text:
1. Ensure you're on a page with analysis tools
  2. Open the area selector
  3. Choose a country
  4. Select an area from the list
  5. The area boundary appears on the map
  6. Proceed with your analysis

docs.title: Area Requirements for Analysis
docs.text:
Different analyses have different requirements:

  • Spatial Coverage: Area must be within data coverage
  • Size: Very large areas may take longer to process
  • Geometry: Must be valid polygon geometry

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Naming Convention: Use descriptive names
  2. Example: "Niger_Agriculture_Zone_1"

  3. Include location and purpose

  4. Country Organization: Group areas by country

  5. Makes management easier

  6. Enables country-specific analyses

  7. Version Control: For updated areas:

  8. Add version numbers: "Area_v1", "Area_v2"

  9. Or use dates: "Area_2024_01"

  10. Documentation: Note area purpose:

  11. Use descriptive names
  12. Consider keeping notes elsewhere

docs.title: Area Limits
docs.text:
• Per User: No hard limit (check system capacity)
  • Per Country: Unlimited areas per country
  • Size: Very large areas may impact performance

docs.title: Example GeoJSON Structure
docs.text:
{
  "type": "FeatureCollection",
  "features": [
    {
      "type": "Feature",
      "geometry": {
        "type": "Polygon",
        "coordinates": [[
          [longitude1, latitude1],
          [longitude2, latitude2],
          [longitude3, latitude3],
          [longitude1, latitude1]
        ]]
      },
      "properties": {
        "name": "My Area"
      }
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Creating GeoJSON Files
docs.text:
You can create GeoJSON files using:

  • QGIS: Export as GeoJSON
  • ArcGIS: Export to GeoJSON
  • Online Tools: geojson.io, GeoJSON Editor
  • Python: Using GeoPandas or similar libraries

docs.title: Coordinate System
docs.text:
• Required: EPSG:4326 (WGS84)
  • Automatic Conversion: System converts if needed
  • Verification: Check coordinates are valid lat/lon

docs.title: Upload Failed
docs.text:
Problem: GeoJSON upload fails

Solutions: - Verify file format (valid GeoJSON) - Check geometry type (Polygon/MultiPolygon) - Ensure coordinates are valid - Check file size limits - Verify coordinate system

docs.title: Area Not Appearing
docs.text:
Problem: Area doesn't show on map

Solutions: - Check area is selected - Verify map zoom level - Refresh the page - Check browser console for errors

docs.title: Cannot Delete Area
docs.text:
Problem: Delete operation fails

Solutions: - Ensure you're the area owner - Check for active analyses - Try again after a moment - Contact support if persistent

docs.title: Duplicate Name Error
docs.text:
Problem: "Area with this name already exists"

Solutions: - Use a different name - Add version number or date - Delete old area if replacing - Check country selection

docs.title: Invalid Geometry Error
docs.text:
Problem: "Unsupported geometry types"

Solutions: - Convert to Polygon or MultiPolygon - Use QGIS or similar tool to fix geometry - Ensure geometry is valid - Check for self-intersections

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
1. Start Small: Test with small areas first
  2. Save Often: Areas are saved automatically
  3. Backup: Keep GeoJSON files as backups
  4. Organize: Use consistent naming conventions
  5. Document: Note area purposes and dates

Next: Analysis Tools Guide

docs.title: Authentication Guide
docs.text: This guide covers user authentication, account management, and security features in EO-Toolkit.

docs.title: Creating an Account
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the registration page (/accounts/register/)
  2. Fill in the registration form:
  3. Username: Choose a unique username (required)
  4. Email: Your email address (required, used for verification)
  5. Password: Create a strong password (required)
  6. Password Confirmation: Re-enter your password
  7. Click Register

Password Requirements

Use a strong password with: - At least 8 characters - Mix of uppercase and lowercase letters - Numbers and special characters

docs.title: Email Verification
docs.text:
After registration:

  1. You'll be redirected to the email verification page
  2. Your account is created but inactive until verified
  3. Click Send OTP to receive a verification code
  4. Check your email inbox (and spam folder) for the OTP
  5. Enter the 6-digit code in the verification form
  6. Click Verify

Account Status

You cannot log in until your email is verified. If you don't receive the OTP: - Check your spam folder - Click "Send OTP" again - Verify your email address is correct

docs.title: Signing In
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the login page (/accounts/login/)
  2. Enter your Username and Password
  3. Click Sign In

docs.title: Remember Me
docs.text:
• The login form includes a "Remember me" option
  • This keeps you logged in across browser sessions
  • Use only on trusted devices

docs.title: Forgot Password
docs.text:
If you forget your password:

  1. Click Forgot Password on the login page
  2. Enter your email address
  3. Check your email for password reset instructions
  4. Follow the link to reset your password
  5. Create a new password

docs.title: Changing Your Password
docs.text:
1. Log in to your account
  2. Navigate to Account Settings → Change Password
  3. Enter your current password
  4. Enter your new password
  5. Confirm the new password
  6. Click Change Password

Security Best Practices

  • Change your password regularly
  • Use unique passwords for different services
  • Never share your password
  • Log out when using shared computers

docs.title: Email Verification
docs.text:
• Email verification is required for account activation
  • OTP codes expire after a set time period
  • You can request a new OTP if needed

docs.title: Session Management
docs.text:
• Sessions expire after a period of inactivity
  • You'll be logged out automatically for security
  • Log in again to continue using the application

docs.title: Logout
docs.text:
To log out:

  1. Click on your username in the top menu
  2. Select Logout
  3. Or navigate to /accounts/logout/

Public Computers

Always log out when using public or shared computers to protect your account.

docs.title: Profile Information
docs.text:
• Username: Cannot be changed after registration
  • Email: Contact support to change your email address
  • Password: Can be changed anytime through settings

docs.title: Privacy
docs.text:
• Your account information is kept private
  • Areas and analyses are private to your account
  • Reports are only accessible by you

docs.title: Cannot Log In
docs.text:
Problem: "Invalid username or password"

Solutions: - Verify your username is correct - Check if Caps Lock is on - Try resetting your password - Ensure your account is verified

docs.title: Email Not Received
docs.text:
Problem: OTP email not arriving

Solutions: - Check spam/junk folder - Verify email address is correct - Wait a few minutes and try again - Contact support if issue persists

docs.title: Account Locked
docs.text:
Problem: Account appears locked or inactive

Solutions: - Complete email verification - Check if account was deactivated - Contact support for assistance

docs.title: Password Reset Not Working
docs.text:
Problem: Password reset link not working

Solutions: - Check if link has expired (usually valid for 24 hours) - Request a new password reset - Clear browser cache and cookies - Try a different browser

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
If you continue to experience authentication issues:

  1. Check the Troubleshooting Guide
  2. Contact support through the Contact Us page
  3. Provide details about the issue you're experiencing

Next: Data Catalog Guide

docs.title: Data Catalog Guide
docs.text: The Data Catalog is your gateway to accessing Earth Observation datasets, training materials, case studies, and custom applications in EO-Toolkit.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Data Catalog provides access to:

  • Thematic Data: Earth Observation datasets from Google Earth Engine and GeoServer
  • Training Materials: Educational resources, tutorials, and guides
  • Case Studies: Real-world application examples
  • Custom Apps: External applications and tools
  • Partners: Information about data providers and partners

docs.title: Accessing the Catalog
docs.text:
1. Log in to your account
  2. Click Data Catalog in the navigation menu
  3. Select the catalog type you want to browse:
  4. Thematic Data
  5. Training Materials
  6. Case Studies
  7. Custom Apps

docs.title: Thematic Data Catalog
docs.text:
The Thematic Data catalog includes:

  • GEE Datasets: Google Earth Engine datasets
  • GeoServer Layers: Uploaded spatial data layers
  • Metadata: Descriptions, providers, and keywords
  • Thumbnails: Visual previews of datasets

docs.title: Viewing Dataset Details
docs.text:
1. Click on any dataset card
  2. View detailed information:
  3. Dataset name and description
  4. Data provider/partner
  5. Keywords and categories
  6. Spatial extent
  7. Temporal coverage
  8. Usage instructions

docs.title: Viewing Data on Map
docs.text:
1. From the dataset details page
  2. Click View on Map
  3. The dataset will be loaded in the map viewer
  4. Use map controls to explore the data

docs.title: Training Materials
docs.text:
Browse educational resources:

  • Categories: Filter by topic
  • Sources: Filter by provider
  • Languages: Filter by language
  • Search: Find specific materials

docs.title: Case Studies
docs.text:
Explore real-world applications:

  • Publishers: Filter by organization
  • Types: Filter by study type
  • Year: Filter by publication year
  • Search: Find relevant case studies

docs.title: Custom Apps
docs.text:
Access external applications:

  • Keywords: Filter by topic
  • Search: Find specific apps
  • Links: Direct access to applications

docs.title: Using Search
docs.text:
1. Enter keywords in the search box
  2. Search matches:
  3. Dataset titles
  4. Descriptions
  5. Keywords
  6. Results update automatically

docs.title: Applying Filters
docs.text:
Filters vary by catalog type:

Thematic Data: - GEE Categories - Theme - Project Phase - Partner/Provider

Training Materials: - Category - Source - Language

Case Studies: - Publisher - Type - Issued Year

Custom Apps: - Keywords

docs.title: Using Filters
docs.text:
1. Expand filter sections
  2. Select one or more filter options
  3. Results update automatically
  4. Clear filters to reset

docs.title: Pagination
docs.text:
• Results are paginated (30 items per page)
  • Use navigation arrows to browse pages
  • Page numbers show current position

docs.title: Dataset Cards Display
docs.text:
Each dataset card shows:

  • Thumbnail: Visual preview
  • Title: Dataset name
  • Description: Brief overview
  • Provider: Data source
  • Keywords: Relevant tags
  • Upload Date: When added to catalog

docs.title: Detailed View
docs.text:
Clicking a dataset opens detailed information:

  • Full description
  • Technical specifications
  • Usage guidelines
  • Spatial and temporal coverage
  • Related resources

docs.title: GeoServer Datasets
docs.text:
GeoServer datasets are uploaded by administrators and include:

  • Raster Data: GeoTIFF files
  • Vector Data: Shapefiles
  • Styles: SLD styling files
  • Thumbnails: Preview images

docs.title: Viewing GeoServer Layers
docs.text:
1. Select a GeoServer dataset
  2. Click View on Map
  3. Layer loads with:
  4. WMS tile URL
  5. Spatial extent
  6. Legend information
  7. Style information

docs.title: Recommendations
docs.text:
The Search/Recommendations feature provides:

  • Theme-based: Filter by development theme
  • Phase-based: Filter by project phase
  • Country-specific: Recommendations for selected countries
  • Contextual: Relevant data, training, and case studies

docs.title: Using Recommendations
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Search page
  2. Select:
  3. Theme (e.g., Agriculture, Water, Climate)
  4. Project Phase
  5. Country
  6. View recommended:
  7. Datasets
  8. Training materials
  9. Case studies
  10. Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Use Filters: Narrow down results efficiently
  2. Read Descriptions: Understand data before using
  3. Check Coverage: Verify spatial and temporal coverage
  4. Review Metadata: Check data quality and sources
  5. Save Favorites: Bookmark useful datasets
  6. Explore Related: Check related resources

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Keywords: Use specific keywords for better results
  • Multiple Filters: Combine filters for precise results
  • Clear Filters: Reset to see all available data
  • Export Lists: Note down useful dataset IDs
  • Check Updates: Catalog is regularly updated

docs.title: No Results Found
docs.text: Solutions: - Clear filters and search terms - Check spelling - Try broader search terms - Verify catalog type selection

docs.title: Dataset Not Loading
docs.text: Solutions: - Check internet connection - Verify dataset availability - Try refreshing the page - Contact support if issue persists

docs.title: Map Not Displaying
docs.text:
Solutions: - Check browser console for errors - Verify GeoServer connection - Ensure area of interest is selected - Try a different dataset

Next: Area Management Guide

docs.title: User Guide Overview
docs.text: Welcome to the EO-Toolkit User Guide! This comprehensive guide will help you make the most of all the features available in the platform.

docs.title: What is EO-Toolkit?
docs.text: EO-Toolkit is a web-based GIS platform that combines Earth Observation data, AI-powered analytics, and interactive mapping tools. It's designed to support development projects by providing location-specific insights across various domains.

docs.title: Authentication & User Management
docs.text:
• User registration with email verification
  • Secure login and password management
  • User profile management

docs.title: Data Catalog
docs.text:
• Browse thematic Earth Observation datasets
  • Access training materials and resources
  • Explore case studies
  • Discover custom applications
  • View partner information

docs.title: Interactive Mapping
docs.text:
• Draw custom areas of interest
  • Upload GeoJSON files
  • Visualize multiple data layers
  • Zoom, pan, and explore maps

docs.title: Analysis Tools
docs.text:
• Land Use Land Cover (LULC) analysis
  • Precipitation analysis (CHIRPS)
  • Actual Evapotranspiration (ETa)
  • Climate change projections
  • Water storage analysis (GRACE)

docs.title: Report Generation
docs.text:
• Generate comprehensive PDF reports
  • Include multiple analyses
  • Customize themes and project phases
  • Download and share reports

docs.title: GeoServer Integration
docs.text:
• Upload spatial data layers
  • Manage raster and vector data
  • Style layers with SLD files
  • Publish data for visualization

docs.title: Navigation Structure
docs.text:
The application is organized into several main sections:

Home
├── Data Catalog
│   ├── Thematic Data
│   ├── Training Materials
│   ├── Case Studies
│   └── Custom Apps
├── Search/Recommendations
├── Area Management
├── Analysis Tools
└── Reports

docs.title: Regular User
docs.text:
• Access all public features
  • Create and manage areas
  • Run analyses
  • Generate reports
  • Browse data catalog

docs.title: Administrator
docs.text:
• All regular user features
  • Access Django admin panel
  • Manage GeoServer data uploads
  • Configure system settings
  • Manage users and permissions

docs.title: Getting Started Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Create an account and verify email
  • [ ] Complete your profile
  • [ ] Explore the data catalog
  • [ ] Create your first area
  • [ ] Run a simple analysis
  • [ ] Generate your first report

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: Learn about user accounts, registration, login, and password management.

docs.title: Data Catalog
docs.text: Comprehensive guide to browsing, searching, and using the data catalog.

docs.title: Area Management
docs.text: How to create, manage, and use areas of interest for analysis.

docs.title: Analysis Tools
docs.text: Detailed guide to all available analysis types and how to use them.

docs.title: Reports
docs.text: Learn how to generate, download, and interpret analysis reports.

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• Installation Guide
  • First Steps
  • Features Documentation
  • Troubleshooting

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Organize Your Areas: Use descriptive names and organize by country
  2. Explore Before Analyzing: Browse available data before running analyses
  3. Start Simple: Begin with basic analyses before moving to complex ones
  4. Save Your Work: Areas and analyses are saved automatically
  5. Check Data Availability: Some analyses require specific data availability
  6. Review Reports: Always review generated reports for accuracy

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
If you need help:

  1. Check the FAQs
  2. Review relevant documentation sections
  3. Contact support through the Contact Us page
  4. Check the Troubleshooting guide

Continue to the next sections to learn about specific features in detail!

docs.title: Reports Guide
docs.text: EO-Toolkit can generate comprehensive PDF reports combining multiple analyses. This guide covers report generation, content, and usage.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Reports provide:

  • Comprehensive Analysis: Multiple analyses in one document
  • Visualizations: Charts and maps
  • Data Summary: Key statistics and findings
  • Professional Format: PDF format for sharing
  • Customizable: Theme and project phase selection

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before generating a report:

  1. Area Required: Must have a saved area
  2. Completed Analyses: Area should have completed analyses
  3. Theme Selection: Choose appropriate theme
  4. Project Phase: Select project phase

docs.title: Step-by-Step Process
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Reports:
  2. Access through area management

  3. Or from analysis results page

  4. Select Area:

  5. Choose area with completed analyses

  6. Verify area has analysis results

  7. Fill Report Details:

  8. Theme: Select theme (e.g., Agriculture, Water, Climate)
  9. Project Phase: Select phase (e.g., Planning, Implementation)

  10. Country: Verify country selection

  11. Generate Report:

  12. Click "Generate Report" button
  13. Report generation starts asynchronously

  14. Task ID is provided for tracking

  15. Monitor Progress:

  16. Check task status
  17. Wait for completion
  18. Download when ready

docs.title: Report Generation Process
docs.text:
Reports are generated asynchronously using Celery:

  1. Task Creation: Task is queued
  2. Processing: Report is generated in background
  3. Completion: Report is saved
  4. Notification: Status updates available
  5. Download: Report available for download

docs.title: Standard Sections
docs.text:
Reports typically include:

  1. Cover Page:
  2. Report title
  3. Area information
  4. Generation date

  5. Theme and phase

  6. Executive Summary:

  7. Key findings
  8. Overview of analyses

  9. Main conclusions

  10. Area Information:

  11. Area name and location
  12. Geographic boundaries

  13. Map visualization

  14. Analysis Results:

  15. LULC analysis (if available)
  16. Precipitation analysis (if available)
  17. ETa analysis (if available)
  18. Climate projections (if available)

  19. Water storage analysis (if available)

  20. Charts and Visualizations:

  21. Pie charts
  22. Time series charts

  23. Maps and spatial visualizations

  24. Data Tables:

  25. Statistical summaries
  26. Area calculations

  27. Trend data

  28. Recommendations:

  29. Data recommendations
  30. Training materials
  31. Case studies
  32. Next steps

docs.title: Customization Options
docs.text:
• Theme: Affects recommendations and focus
  • Project Phase: Influences content emphasis
  • Country: Provides country-specific context

docs.title: Viewing Report Status
docs.text:
1. Check task status using task ID
  2. Status indicators:
  3. Pending: Report queued
  4. Progress: Report being generated
  5. Success: Report ready
  6. Failure: Error occurred

docs.title: Downloading Reports
docs.text:
1. Navigate to report section
  2. Find completed report
  3. Click download button
  4. Save PDF file

docs.title: Report Storage
docs.text:
• Reports are stored on the server
  • Associated with area and user
  • Can be re-downloaded
  • Deleted when area is deleted

docs.title: Viewing Report History
docs.text:
• Access through area management
  • View all reports for an area
  • See generation dates
  • Check report status

docs.title: Deleting Reports
docs.text:
1. Select report from history
  2. Click delete button
  3. Confirm deletion
  4. Report is removed

Deletion Warning

Deleting a report is permanent. Download and save important reports before deletion.

docs.title: Re-generating Reports
docs.text:
If you need to update a report:

  1. Run new analyses if needed
  2. Generate new report
  3. Old report remains available
  4. New report has updated data

docs.title: Before Generation
docs.text:
1. Complete Analyses: Run all desired analyses first
  2. Verify Results: Review analysis results
  3. Select Appropriate Theme: Choose relevant theme
  4. Check Area: Ensure correct area selected

docs.title: After Generation
docs.text:
1. Review Report: Check content and formatting
  2. Download: Save report locally
  3. Share: Distribute as needed
  4. Archive: Keep for records

docs.title: Report Quality
docs.text:
• Completeness: Include all relevant analyses
  • Accuracy: Verify data and results
  • Clarity: Ensure clear visualizations
  • Relevance: Select appropriate theme and phase

docs.title: Report Generation Failed
docs.text:
Problem: Report generation fails

Solutions: - Check area has completed analyses - Verify all required fields filled - Check server status - Try again after a moment - Contact support with task ID

docs.title: Report Not Appearing
docs.text:
Problem: Report doesn't show in list

Solutions: - Check report status - Refresh the page - Verify user account - Check area association - Contact support

docs.title: Report Download Failed
docs.text:
Problem: Cannot download report

Solutions: - Check report is complete - Verify file exists - Try different browser - Clear browser cache - Contact support

docs.title: Report Content Issues
docs.text:
Problem: Report missing content or errors

Solutions: - Verify analyses completed successfully - Check area has valid data - Regenerate report - Contact support with details

docs.title: Slow Generation
docs.text:
Problem: Report takes very long

Solutions: - Check server status - Verify area size - Be patient for complex reports - Check task queue status - Contact support if excessive delay

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
1. Plan Ahead: Run analyses before generating report
  2. Save Copies: Download and archive important reports
  3. Review First: Check report before sharing
  4. Use Appropriate Theme: Select relevant theme
  5. Document: Note report purpose and date
  6. Share Selectively: Share reports appropriately

docs.text:
• Initial assessment
  • Data collection planning
  • Resource allocation

docs.title: Monitoring
docs.text:
• Progress tracking
  • Change detection
  • Performance evaluation

docs.title: Reporting
docs.text:
• Stakeholder reports
  • Donor reports
  • Technical documentation

docs.title: Decision Making
docs.text:
• Data-driven decisions
  • Policy development
  • Resource management

This completes the User Guide. For more information, see: - Features Documentation - API Reference - Administration Guide
